bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Mary A. Benjamin, June 10, 1953

div1.p: Hench informs Benjamin that Blossom Reed is trying sell some books autographed by her father, Walter Reed.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Mary A. Benjamin, June 10, 1953
div1.opener:
June 10, 1953
Miss Mary A. Benjamin, Director
Walter R. Benjamin
1 East 57th Street
New York 22, New York
My dear Miss Benjamin:
div1.p:
Apropos of my telephone conversation with you, when I was in New York a
month ago (I have been too busy since my return to do anything more about
this), let me enclose a list of the personal books owned by Walter Reed
which are available for sale. You will see that of the eight books, six
have his autograph and a date, one has just his autograph and the one volume
of the series of five is not autographed or dated. Perhaps with this more
precise information you can give me more idea of whether you are interested
in purchasing these books.

May I repeat that they have been put in my hands by a very close relative of
Walter Reed whose financial status is such that she certainly can use the
money. I can guarantee absolutely as to the authenticity of the signatures
as I have scores of letters of Walter Reed presented to me by the family,
including the member who made these available. In this matter I am acting
solely by motives of friendship toward the relative and admiration toward
Walter Reed. I am anxious of course to get for the relative as good a price
as possible.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
